You were dared by friends(well the closet things you had to "friends") at school to enter the towns abandoned Cinema, it was the towns oldest and most wore down building, naturally making it the "haunted" spot in towns where couples, fools, and brave kids went to prove themselves and have a little fun. You being single and not feeling the tiniest bit brave knew which you belonged in, treading past the pitch dark doors dust and spiders webs(no spiders yet) you're only company you did not feel like you were having any fun.

You're "friends" told you to prove that you treaded all the through and not just waited at the entrance for a hour you had to grab one of the old film reels, they said there should be some in the projector room. As you creaked through the pitched lobby minding you're own business, praying to everything to just let you do this one thing so you can go home you tried to not noticed the torn and burned posters, they were all distorted but even then you could not make out any familiar faces. This Cinema was small and old and only had one theater so finding the stairs to the projector room was not hard. Looking up expecting the worse you were oddly surprised, unlike the rest of the Cinema the stairs leading to and the room itself felt untouched by decay and age. Almost like new. Strange.

The projector was there shining like it was freshly delivered, and there were boxes all around you, it was odd you were in encased room but the number boxes seemed to keep changing. Wanting to leave sooner rather then later you grabbed one of them randomly and looked inside. There were four closed reels inside and looking at them, all the fear of this place, the urgency to leave, and the want to go back home. All of it vanished, now all you wanted all you needed was to play one of these reels, live one of these films. But which one?

There reels were as follows...
"The Plumper's are Inside the House!"- You live in a house where after a vacation all the female members of the family come back different, larger they start to wear different outfits and they give you weird looks and with no father to speak of and summer break just starting will you be able to get out of the house without you new large family getting their hands and other areas on you before you can get to the bottom of this mystery?

"Plumper of the Dead!"- You and a group of friends were dared to go to a graveyard at night after school, you all sneak into some crypt and found a old text one of you're friends not listening to you're warnings starts reading the text out-loud, lighting and thunder strike, then when you were all about to laugh it up and walk outside the dead in the crypt start to rise, though they all seem to be only woman and shapely and they are giving you and the others odd looks with their dead eyes.

"It Came From Planet Plump!"(1950s)- You were a young scientist who always loved the stars one night when you were out late gazing on one of you're favorite hills just after you're young wife convinced you to come back to tuck the kids in you see a strange fast moving object, letting curiosity getting the better of you, you had to follow it. You know what they say about curiosity.... What you find is out of a Sci-Fi book, an alien saucer crashed landed you had to get a better look but before you get the chance a hatch opens and one of the largest women with green skin exits the craft, is she alone or is she the first? What does she want with you?

"Dr.Jackie and Mrs.Plump!"- In High School you hated most of you're teachers save one, the small, cute, and meek Dr.Jackie at least that's what everyone calls the brilliant science teacher. But one night late in her lab an experiment goes wrong in every way and now when ever the cute Dr.Jackie gets excited or "wanting" of something ot better someone she becomes the exact opposite, the large, crude, strong, and rude Mrs.Plump who for one reason or another has her eyes set on you! Can Dr.Jackie make a cure or is Mrs.Plump calling the shots?

If none of these caught you're interest there were all the other boxes around you're feet....

134.content:
Dan takes a step back from the gargantuan green space amazon, his neck still straining to look up at her. She's standing still for the moment, her black, shining eyes staring at him appraisingly, her forked tongue still running across her lips. Through the green mist behind her, Dan can see more shapes moving; she didn't come here alone.

As if the alien senses Dan's growing fear, she whistles. Two more green behemoths exit the spacecraft, take their spots at either side of the first one, and also eye Dan's body as if he were a piece of meat. Dan turns and runs.

Dan has never been much of an athlete, but his terror gives him speed. In no time at all, he covers the distance between the landing site and his bike. As he fumbles with the lock (why did he have to lock his bike in the middle of the woods?), he glances back and sees a green glow steadily making its way closer to him. Another few seconds, and he sees it's the three gargantuan space-women, hovering just slightly off the forest floor and making a beeline to him. Dan barely has time to mount his bike and pedal away before the women are right next to him. As he pedals down the road, just staying ahead of the aliens, it never occurs to him that maybe the only reason he's able to get away so quickly is because they're letting him.

Dan makes his escape, the trio of alien amazons hot on his tail, thinking only of getting home to safety and warning his family (and alerting the media). The question is, does he really make it?

152.content:
Jesse Bodine finishes heaving the last bale of hay and rests against the fence at the edge of his aunt's farm. The fourteen-year-old city boy's parents sent him here for the summer, and he's hated every minute of it. His aunt is cruel and domineering, the work is dull and exhausting, and there is nothing to do around here, nothing but cows and chores and more cows and more chores. The heat only makes things worse; Jesse's already had to strip out of his shirt and underwear, his overalls are only barely clinging to his body (he's slimmed down considerably since he came here), and he is covered head-to-toe in sweat, even with an afternoon breeze kicking it right now.

Out of nowhere, he hears something over the background mooing of his aunt's cattle. Circus music.

Now that's odd. Okay, no. "Odd" is an understatement. The closest thing to excitement Jesse's seen all summer was a trip to Wal-mart last month. A sudden, unexpected circus is weird, and Jesse knows all too well that this is the only break from boredom and drudgery he's going to have in a good long while.

He reaches down and picks up his walkie-talkie. "Aunt Jo, there's something weird at the edge of the property. I think I'm gonna check it out." He sets the radio down next to his discarded shirt and underwear and leaves without waiting for a reply. He can deal with whatever discipline she wants to give out later; this circus will be worth it.

He follows the sound of the circus through the woods. As he gets closer, the music sounds increasingly off in a way he can't really describe. It's like a distorted copy of circus music, or maybe their speakers are just old and crappy. The smells eventually hit him too, and they are also slightly, disturbingly off. It smells like roasted peanuts, cotton candy, and various fried things, but it also smells chemically somehow, or antiseptic. Then again, Jesse thinks, who knows what kind of drugs these circus-folk might be up to? And he's probably coming from the back way anyway, so maybe this is just what a circus smells like from the other side.

In any event, Jesse reaches the circus after about thirty minutes of walking. The circus looks almost empty, just a collection of huge, oddly-colored tents made of a fabric he can't recognize, sitting in the middle of a clearing. He can't see any people around, but the place is obviously set up for people to be there. Jesse slowly circles around the biggest tent--an orange and purple construct over 90 feet tall--trying to find an entrance, or maybe a person. He does find the exit, but there's no one there, just an empty, yawning void inside. The air is cooler in there, much cooler than the outside, though Jesse can't hear any generators.

"Hello?" he calls out. No answer. He calls out again, and again hears nothing back. He glances around, confirms that he is still alone, and sticks his head into the tent. It almost looks bigger on the inside, and the eerie, off-sounding circus music echoes in the darkness. He can faintly make out a pathway, but not quite where it leads.

A white shape shambles out of the darkness, into the faint cone of light Jesse can see from the tent flap. Jesse has to squint his eyes and take a step closer to make out just what it is. He almost laughs when he realizes it's a clown. And "it" is really a "she."

The clown is one of the largest, fattest women Jesse has ever seen. She stands close to six feet tall and probably weighs more than 500 pounds. Her makeup is intense: it makes her skin look lumpy, almost rubbery, and it flows and takes strange, curving shapes across her frame. Her belly is close to twice the size of Jesse's whole body, and each of her mammoth breasts is wider than her whole chest. Her ass must be wider than Jesse is tall. The clown's bulbous red nose looks like it's actually part of her face, and her eyes and mouth are ringed in pale blue paint that make her look like a sinister, scheming beast. The yellow eyes must be contact lenses, and the yellowed, pointy teeth are probably prosthetic. The talon-like fake nails look especially convincing too. The whole effect makes her look grotesquely amusing, and impossible to look away from.

The clown sees that Jesse has noticed her and beckons him closer. "Yoo-hoo," she croons exaggeratedly, like a cartoon.

15532222221.content:
This movie sounds interesting, so you set up the equipment to watch it. The credit sequence is promising, featuring closeups of the titular Robo-Plumpers’ huge, smooth, metallic frames posing menacingly and towering over (and wider than) the humans assembling them.

The action then cuts to a gearing-up sequence as two teens—a boy and a girl, who the movie later informs you are twin siblings Dale and Gail—prepare to break into the mall and vandalize it. They’re oddly young to be the apparent leads in an adult horror film; they don’t look a day over 14. They’re also very slightly built and share each others’ freckles and curly red hair. Either the producers actually cast real twins in the roles, or they did a fantastic job finding two teen actors who could pass for twin brother and sister.

You’re a bit distracted trying to IMDB this mystery while the first few minutes play out, so you’re only half aware of the details of how the twins break into the mall, and while you know they’re bantering, you miss the cheesy quips the writers—probably 40-somethings who had never seen a teenager before—thought were clever. Your phone suddenly loses connection and a red light washes over you, snapping you to attention.

A Robo-Plumper is staring directly at you from the screen, its—her?—red visor glowing brightly with malice. You know it’s just a movie, but the intensity of the stare feels like it’s pointed right at you. You drop your phone and lean in closer to the screen, and you start to feel the movie as if it were actually happening to you. Your heart beats a little faster as you see the Robo-Plumper stalk her way towards one of the teens, intending to punish them harshly for their trespassing.

Which teen does the Robo-Plumper get to first, and what is that teen doing to earn her wrath?
